speaker: ANNOUNCER
line: Previously on the X-Files...

speaker: SKINNER
line: Dr. Merkmallen found an artifact in his country. He claimed it contained a message.

speaker: DR. MERKMALLEN
line: I told you of its power.

speaker: MULDER
line: Genuine artifact.

speaker: MULDER
line: Dr. Barnes has one now, too. That's why he killed Solomon Merkmallen.

speaker: SCULLY
line: What is it, Mulder?

speaker: MULDER
line: Sounds weird, but I think it's that thing.

speaker: DR. HARRIMAN
line: He's got extremely abnormal brain function. There's brain activity in areas we've never seen before.

speaker: DIANA FOWLEY
line: He said I was the only one who'd believe him.

speaker: SCULLY
line: You're a liar.

speaker: SCULLY
line: The passage from the Bible on an artifact that you were saying is extraterrestrial?

speaker: MULDER
line: That would mean that our progenitors were alien, that our genesis was alien, that we're here because of them, that they put us here. And once you see all the mysteries of science, everything we can't understand or won't explain, everything in the X-Files, it all leads to them; it's from them.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I came in search of something I did not believe existed. I've stayed on now, in spite of myself. In spite of everything I've ever held to be true. I will continue here as long as I can... as long as you are beset by the haunting illness which I saw consume your beautiful mind. What is this discovery I've made? How can I reconcile what I see with what I know? I feel this was meant not for me to find but for you... to make sense of -- make the connections which can't be ignored... connections which, for me, deny all logic and reason. What is this source of power I hold in my hand -- this rubbing -- a simple impression taken from the surface of the craft? I watched this rubbing take its undeniable hold on you, saw you succumb to its spiraling effect.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Now I must work to uncover what your illness prevents you from finding. In the source of every illness lies its cure.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Who's there? Who's there?!

speaker: DR. HARRIMAN
line: He's been quiet for the last 36 hours, but he doesn't sleep. There's activity in the temporal lobe we've just never seen. It won't allow his brain to rest or shut down, manifesting in episodes of aggression... sometimes against himself.

speaker: SKINNER
line: You can't sedate him?

speaker: DR. HARRIMAN
line: Yes. We slow him down for short periods and put him in the neuro ward. It's the only way we're able to run tests. But over time... his brain is going to just die.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Agent Mulder? Agent Mulder, can you hear me?

speaker: SKINNER
line: Do you know who I am? It's Skinner, Walter Skinner. Can we get him out of here and get him some fresh air, at least?

speaker: DR. HARRIMAN
line: Let him go! He can't breathe!

speaker: SKINNER
line: Let go, Mulder. I don't want to hurt you.

speaker: ORDERLY
line: Come on, let him go.

speaker: DR. HARRIMAN
line: Stay there, Mr. Skinner.

speaker: SKINNER
line: No, it's all right. Just let me get up.

speaker: DR. HARRIMAN
line: Five milligrams of Haloperidol IM! I want him in five-point restraints!

speaker: ORDERLY
line: Yes, sir.

speaker: DR. HARRIMAN
line: Let's keep him locked down all night.

speaker: AMINA NGEBE
line: My God. What happened here?

speaker: AMINA NGEBE
line: They said you speak English.

speaker: SCULLY
line: What do you want?

speaker: AMINA NGEBE
line: I am sorry. You must wonder who I am. I am Amina Ngebe. I've come to see your discovery.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I asked that no one be told about it... nor that I'm here.

speaker: AMINA NGEBE
line: Yes. Well, uh, it is still a secret but a well-known one, I'm afraid. Dr. Merkmallen called it the African Internet, God rest him.

speaker: SCULLY
line: You knew Dr. Merkmallen?

speaker: AMINA NGEBE
line: I, too, am a professor of biology at the university but, uh, hardly one qualified to say what must have gone on here.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Well... I was working late last night by lamplight and, uh, I saw a man who vanished... and then they just swarmed.

speaker: AMINA NGEBE
line: You must not let the men know what happened to you last night-- the vanishing man, none of it.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Why?

speaker: AMINA NGEBE
line: They are animists, believing nature is vengeful. They'll take this as a sign to leave what you have found alone, a bad omen.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Caused by the ship out there?

speaker: AMINA NGEBE
line: Mmm. Caused by God... who will be much less helpful than those men if we are to continue this work.

speaker: MAN IN WATER
line: : Help... Help me!

speaker: MAN IN WATER
line: : The water, it boils!

speaker: SCULLY
line: Let's get him in the truck! He's got to get to a hospital! Hospital!

speaker: SCULLY
line: Okay!

speaker: AMINA NGEBE
line: You see? Another warning.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Agent Mulder. I want to help you. I don't know what to do. I don't have much time.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Can you write?

speaker: SCULLY
line: I feel you slipping away from me with every minute I fail here. What are the elusive meanings I cannot see that are hidden here? If I could understand it, know how it affected you, learn how to use its power to save you.

speaker: SCULLY
line: What is it?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Look, I'm sorry. I don't speak your language.

speaker: DR. BARNES
line: Perhaps you need an interpreter.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Stay away from me!

speaker: DR. BARNES
line: Are you going to hack me up in front of my driver? Word is you're under suspicion already.

speaker: SCULLY
line: You're the murderer here.

speaker: AMINA NGEBE
line: Murderer of who?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Dr. Merkmallen!

speaker: DR. BARNES
line: I murdered no one but I won't be sent away from here. I know what we've got. This craft that's come ashore? Its extraterrestrial origins?

speaker: SCULLY
line: You don't even believe in that.

speaker: DR. BARNES
line: Nor do you. But here we are.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I'm here only to help my partner.

speaker: DR. BARNES
line: Then let me help you... to read it. I've spent my life looking for what's out there... the answer to what theologians have pondered for millennia... the key to everything... to life itself. I've already been threatened by men in Washington about what I know. How long would your secret keep if you were to send me away?

speaker: SCULLY
line: What is it?

speaker: AMINA NGEBE
line: It is a sea of blood.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Michael Kritschgau.

speaker: MICHAEL KRITSCHGAU
line: It's 6:00 in the morning.

speaker: SKINNER
line: I don't know if you remember me. My name's Skinner. I'm here to talk to you about Fox Mulder.

speaker: MICHAEL KRITSCHGAU
line: Yeah, I'm listening.

speaker: SKINNER
line: He's in serious condition, Mr. Kritschgau; he has to talk to you.

speaker: MICHAEL KRITSCHGAU
line: I got nothing to say to the man.

speaker: MICHAEL KRITSCHGAU
line: You know, I had a job... with a government pension coming and two years ago, Fox Mulder asked me to do him a favor -- blow the whistle on Uncle Sam's UFO propaganda mill. And all it got me was this swanky address.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Look, he doesn't have much time.

speaker: MICHAEL KRITSCHGAU
line: Hey, I'm not a doctor. What is it you think I can do for him?

speaker: SKINNER
line: All I know is that he asked for you.

speaker: MICHAEL KRITSCHGAU
line: Can he even recognize me?

speaker: SKINNER
line: To be honest, I don't know.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Agent Mulder?

speaker: SKINNER
line: His brain is on constant redline. They've got him on Haloperidol just to keep him on the monitors.

speaker: MICHAEL KRITSCHGAU
line: Haloperidol?

speaker: SKINNER
line: He becomes violently agitated. He just won't speak or sleep even when he's medicated. There's activity in part of his brain they've never seen before.

speaker: MICHAEL KRITSCHGAU
line: Was his...

speaker: SKINNER
line: Was his what?

speaker: MICHAEL KRITSCHGAU
line: I started to ask you a question about his prior mental state but he anticipated it. Second time. Agent Mulder?

speaker: SKINNER
line: He claimed to be hearing voices.

speaker: MICHAEL KRITSCHGAU
line: I might know why Agent Mulder asked for me. Doesn't mean I can do anything for him.

speaker: SKINNER
line: What just happened?

speaker: MICHAEL KRITSCHGAU
line: I think he responded to a question that... I didn't ask.

speaker: SKINNER
line: I don't know how long we can keep him out of that unit. We can be held responsible.

speaker: MICHAEL KRITSCHGAU
line: You asked me to come down here. You better be prepared to accept the responsibility, Mr. Skinner.

speaker: SKINNER
line: You're going to inject him?

speaker: MICHAEL KRITSCHGAU
line: No. You are. With a thousand milligrams of Phenytoin.

speaker: SKINNER
line: I'm not injecting him with anything, not now and not till after I've talked to his doctor.

speaker: MICHAEL KRITSCHGAU
line: He's being given the wrong treatment.

speaker: SKINNER
line: You're not a doctor.

speaker: MICHAEL KRITSCHGAU
line: No, but I've seen his condition. Who do you want to trust?

speaker: SKINNER
line: Seen it where?

speaker: MICHAEL KRITSCHGAU
line: In a study. There's something like E.S.P. called "remote viewing."

speaker: SKINNER
line: Whose study?

speaker: MICHAEL KRITSCHGAU
line: The company's-- the CIA, Mr. Skinner. Extreme subjects would go into arrest their minds working harder than their bodies could sustain. They became, in effect, all brain. Phenytoin was the only thing that could slow the electrical impulses to a normal rate.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Agent Mulder knew about this. That's why he asked for you.

speaker: MULDER
line: They're coming.

speaker: DIANA FOWLEY
line: Who last saw him?

speaker: ICU NURSE
line: I'm looking here.

speaker: DIANA FOWLEY
line: I come here and find a patient missing, and nobody knew?

speaker: ICU NURSE
line: I just came on. Sorry. Fox Mulder, right? He's restrained, it says; and he's not in his bed?

speaker: DIANA FOWLEY
line: No. How many times can I say it?

speaker: ICU NURSE
line: He's right here.

speaker: DIANA FOWLEY
line: He wasn't here when I came in.

speaker: SKINNER
line: No, we just found him down the hall. I just got him back into bed.

speaker: ICU NURSE
line: Who are you?

speaker: SKINNER
line: I'm his boss,...... and hers.

speaker: ICU NURSE
line: Well, I don't know how he could have gotten up by himself or pulled all this stuff out.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Well, I hope someone's calling a doctor making a report on this.

speaker: ICU NURSE
line: He's got to remain in this bed.

speaker: SKINNER
line: I'll stay with him. Agent Fowley, why don't you see if you can help her?

speaker: SKINNER
line: That's an order, Agent Fowley.

speaker: MULDER
line: She knows.

speaker: SKINNER
line: You can read her mind?

speaker: MULDER
line: Yeah. We got to act fast.

speaker: SKINNER
line: The doctor's on his way.

speaker: MULDER
line: No doctors. Get me Scully.

speaker: SKINNER
line: I don't know where she is.

speaker: MULDER
line: Look... I know you've been compromised. I know Krycek is threatening your life... Blackmailing you. You don't think I can trust you but it's not you that I need.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Then who?

speaker: MULDER
line: Him. Kritschgau. Ask him to prove it.

speaker: MICHAEL KRITSCHGAU
line: Prove what?

speaker: MULDER
line: What's causing this.

speaker: MICHAEL KRITSCHGAU
line: It's a brain abnormality. It's how you're able to read minds.

speaker: MULDER
line: What's causing this is alien. That's why my doctors can't help me.

speaker: MICHAEL KRITSCHGAU
line: I don't believe in aliens, Agent Mulder. I think you know that.

speaker: MULDER
line: I do. That's why I need you.

speaker: SCULLY
line: The work here is painstaking-- a slow and tedious piecing together. It appears to be a craft, its skin covered in the intricate symbols you and I both saw but which I now understand are part of a complex communication. Dr. Barnes has broken some of the symbols into letters using an ancient Navajo alphabet and, though it has helped to uncover some of what's here it has also made for greater confusion. On the top surface of the craft I'm finding words describing human genetics. Efforts to read the bottom of the craft have been harder. Our workers were scared away by phenomena I admit I can't explain-- a sea of blood, a swarm of insects. But what little we have found has been staggering-- passages from the Christian Bible, from pagan religions, from Ancient Sumeria... science and mysticism conjoined. But more than words, they are somehow imbued with power. I've ignored warnings to quit this work, remaining committed to finding answers, afraid only that our secret here won't last and that I might be too late.

speaker: AMINA NGEBE
line: I have something to show you...more pieces of the puzzle. I couldn't believe it. I thought I was making it up in my head, that it could not be true.

speaker: SCULLY
line: What?

speaker: AMINA NGEBE
line: What this is. What the symbols spell out is a passage from the Koran. Qeyaamah. "The day of final judgment." On a spacecraft? Teachings of the ancient prophet Mohammed?

speaker: SCULLY
line: I found more, too.

speaker: SCULLY
line: 24 panels... One for each human chromosome. the two sex chromosomes. They get special treatment. Go to for more info on the subject. Thanks Sis 80K and CathyS.] A map of their makeup-- maybe a map of our entire genetic makeup... A complete human genome. I mean, it's like... it's the most beautiful... intricate work of art.

speaker: AMINA NGEBE
line: It is the Word of God.

speaker: DR. BARNES
line: You're wrong. There is no God. What's out there on the water... is only what we call "God"... What we call "creation"-- the spark that ignited the fire that cooked the old primordial soup... made animate from inanimate... made us.

speaker: AMINA NGEBE
line: I believe he is mad from the sun.

speaker: DR. BARNES
line: Mad? I'm perfectly sane... because today I understand everything, beginning and end, alpha and omega, everything in between. It's all been written. But the word is "extraterrestrial."

speaker: SCULLY
line: You're sick, Dr. Barnes. You need to get off your feet, lie down.

speaker: DR. BARNES
line: You think you're going to take the credit? This is my discovery.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I'm only here to help my friend.

speaker: DR. BARNES
line: You can't help him. You're wasting your time reading it.

speaker: SCULLY
line: It has power.

speaker: DR. BARNES
line: It IS power... the ultimate power. Your friend just got too close.

speaker: DR. BARNES
line: No one leaves here before me.

speaker: MICHAEL KRITSCHGAU
line: We developed this to test remote-viewing capabilities. It works much like a card trick. You tap the monitor where the saucer image appears when it appears or when you think it does. Okay?

speaker: MULDER
line: Who ya gonna call?

speaker: MULDER
line: Now. Now. Now. Now. Now. Now. Now. Now.

speaker: MICHAEL KRITSCHGAU
line: All right, Agent Mulder, fine. You're at about five percent accuracy.

speaker: SKINNER
line: I'm assuming that's low.

speaker: MICHAEL KRITSCHGAU
line: Yeah. At the CIA a high degree of ability was 20%. 25% was extraordinary.

speaker: MULDER
line: But I see them in my head.

speaker: SKINNER
line: You saw his ability earlier. It was you who pointed it out.

speaker: MICHAEL KRITSCHGAU
line: Well, our tests showed that some people have psychic abilities, sure. I mean, E.S.P., clairvoyance, remote viewing, but it was never attributed to aliens.

speaker: MULDER
line: You don't want to believe. You're not looking hard enough.

speaker: SKINNER
line: One more time, faster.

speaker: MICHAEL KRITSCHGAU
line: He's ahead of the images. He's anticipating.

speaker: DR. BARNES
line: They've come back! They were dead! They've come back to life! The ship-- it brought them back to life!

speaker: SCULLY
line: We have to get to the police.

speaker: AMINA NGEBE
line: That is where I'm going. This is the road to Abidjan.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Stop!

speaker: SCULLY
line: That was him. That was the man I saw in the tent... in the road.

speaker: PRIMITIVE AFRICAN MAN
line: Some truths are not for you.

speaker: AMINA NGEBE
line: Are you all right?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Oh, God. What are you doing?

speaker: AMINA NGEBE
line: You were cold. I was just feeling to see if you were still alive.

speaker: SCULLY
line: What happened to you?

speaker: AMINA NGEBE
line: To me?

speaker: SCULLY
line: You slammed on the brakes. There was a man.

speaker: AMINA NGEBE
line: That's right-- in the road.

speaker: SCULLY
line: No. He was right there-- sitting right where you are in your seat.

speaker: AMINA NGEBE
line: The men were right. This is a bad sign. A sign to give up.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Turn us around.

speaker: AMINA NGEBE
line: Not back to the beach.

speaker: SCULLY
line: No... I'm going home.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Agent Mulder. Agent Mulder, I don't know if you can hear me but we're going to try to get you out of here.

speaker: MICHAEL KRITSCHGAU
line: A.M. nurse is on in five minutes. We got to move.

speaker: SKINNER
line: I don't think he's in any shape.

speaker: MICHAEL KRITSCHGAU
line: I'm going to hit him pretty hard. Maybe we can get him on his feet. What are you doing?

speaker: SKINNER
line: I know what you're doing.

speaker: MICHAEL KRITSCHGAU
line: I'm trying to help him.

speaker: SKINNER
line: No, this isn't about him -- it's about you, it's about revenge against the government for trying to destroy your life.

speaker: MICHAEL KRITSCHGAU
line: I was destroyed to protect what Mulder knew all along. Now he's the proof-- he's the X-File.

speaker: SKINNER
line: We can't just keep shooting him full of drugs. It's gone too far!

speaker: MICHAEL KRITSCHGAU
line: How far should it go?! How far would Mulder go?!

speaker: DR. HARRIMAN
line: Hey! What's going on here?

speaker: DIANA FOWLEY
line: Let me see your hands. Hands!

speaker: DIANA FOWLEY
line: Step away.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Agent Fowley, what the hell do you think you're doing?

speaker: DIANA FOWLEY
line: What am I doing? What are you doing, sir, with this? I want you to face the wall. Do you hear me? Face the wall.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Let me explain.

speaker: DR. HARRIMAN
line: What was this man given? What was in this syringe?

speaker: DIANA FOWLEY
line: Phenytoin.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Let me tell you what it does.

speaker: DR. HARRIMAN
line: How much did you give him? What dosage was this?

speaker: SKINNER
line: Let me tell you why we did it.

speaker: DR. HARRIMAN
line: He's going into seizure. Watch his head. Mr. Mulder? Hold him. Hold him.

speaker: DR. BARNES' DRIVER
line: Dr. Barnes......Dr. Barnes. Dr. Barnes?

speaker: DR. BARNES
line: I'm so sorry.

speaker: DIANA FOWLEY
line: I know what's happened to you. I know what you're suffering from. I've been sitting back and watching. I know you know. I know you know about me... That my loyalties aren't just to you... but to a man you've grown to despise. You have your reasons but, as you look inside me now you know that I have mine. Fox... Fox, I love you. I've loved you for so long. You know that, too. And I won't let you die... to prove what you are, to prove what's inside you. There's no need to prove it. It's been known for so long. Now we can be together.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Where is he? Is he still in the hospital?

speaker: SKINNER
line: Where have you been?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Is he still at Georgetown Memorial?

speaker: SKINNER
line: You can't get to him.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Do you know where he is or don't you?!

speaker: SKINNER
line: He's in the neuro-psych ward but it's no good, Agent Scully.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Agent Scully!

speaker: SCULLY
line: I have been on a plane for 22 hours. I have to see him.

speaker: SKINNER
line: Then I think you should know what you're going to see if you can even get on the ward. There's been some trouble.

speaker: SCULLY
line: What kind of trouble?

speaker: SKINNER
line: I got this man, Kritschgau, involved.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Kritschgau?

speaker: SKINNER
line: It's a long story, but it ended badly. They've got Mulder under security now around the clock. I take full responsibility.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Responsibility for what?

speaker: SKINNER
line: He can't even communicate, Agent Scully. They won't treat him because they don't know what's wrong with him! They said he was dying. I had to do something.

speaker: SCULLY
line: He's not dying.

speaker: SKINNER
line: I'm afraid it's true.

speaker: SCULLY
line: He's not dying. He is more alive than he has ever been. He's more alive than his body can withstand and what's causing it may be extraterrestrial in origin.

speaker: SKINNER
line: I know. But there's nothing to be done about it.

speaker: SKINNER
line: They're going to deny you access.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Maybe as his partner... but not as his doctor.

speaker: DR. BARNES
line: He's alive! He's come back to life! Holy Mother of God!

speaker: DR. BARNES
line: Hello?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder, it's me. I know that you can hear me. If you can just give me some sign. I want you to know where I've been... what I found. I think that, if you know, that you could find a way to hold on. I need you to hold on. I found a key... the key... to every question that has ever been asked. It's a puzzle...... but the pieces are there for us to put together and I know that they can save you if you can just hold on. Mulder... please. Hold on.
